Package it.polimi.ingsw.network.client

Class ClientReceiver

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.network.client.ClientReceiver
public class ClientReceiver extends Object
This class receives messages from the server, whether synchronous (initiated by the client in the Sender) or asynchronous (receieved from the server as a result of another user's command) This class doesn't deal with the ping routine

    • ClientReceiver

      public ClientReceiver(InitialConnector initialConnector)

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize(InputStream inputStream, MessageBroker mainBroker, AtomicBoolean connected, AtomicBoolean isCommandScheduled)
      Initializes the receiver of messages
      Parameters:
      inputStream - the stream from which to read
      mainBroker - the message broker that will hold the messages that this class should receive
      connected - a boolean shared with the initialConnector and the sender to notify each other of a network problem
      isCommandScheduled - a lock-like atomic boolean used to avoid congesting the queue, also accessed by the sender

    • reset

      public void reset()
      Resets the flags for the receiver and puts it in a state ready to start a new connection with the server It closes the previously opened threads

    • receiveMessages

      public Thread receiveMessages()
      Starts the listening procedure on a new thread and returns

    • parseMessages

      public void parseMessages()
      The main routine. After initialization, this method will continously wait for messages from the server, in response to ones sent by the sender. After receiving one, it will evaluate the command received and call the appropriate ClientController method

    • checkCorrectIdRequest

      private boolean checkCorrectIdRequest()
      Checks that the received reply has the same id as the one sent by the sender just before
      Returns:
      true if the id matches the expected one

    • parseAsyncMessages

      public Thread parseAsyncMessages()
      Creates a thread to parse asynchronous messages from the server and returns
      Returns:
      a Thread containing the asynchronous parsing routine

    • sendAsynchronousACK

      private void sendAsynchronousACK()
      After receiving an asynchronous message from the server, sends an ack message back to the server.
      Not implemented

    • openConnection

      private void openConnection()
      The networking part of this command has been moved to the receiver, the client controller will only handle the visual result of the failed connection

    • closeConnection

      private void closeConnection()
      Notifies the initial connector (and in turn the sender) that a problem occurred then, it calls the appropriate ui screen

    • setUI

      public void setUI(UserInterface ui)
